alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 11:59AM EST until March 12 at 8:05PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. .Minor flooding is ongoing along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White rivers and several tributaries across central and southern Indiana due to 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall that fell Friday March 3rd. Flooding is ongoing along the full length of the Wabash River with the crest near Covington. Much of the White River is in flood from Spencer to Hazleton, with the crest near Elliston. Flooding along the East Fork White River is expected from Seymour to Williams, with the crest near Seymour. Flooding along many smaller tributaries that has not already ended will end by Tuesday. Flooding will continue through the middle to end of the week along portions of the Wabash, White and East Fork White, and into next week on lower portions of these rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Floodwater is near the top of all agricultural levees. Some county roads are impassable. High water isolates a few rural residents. Basement flooding begins along Water Street in Montezuma. Medusa Aggregates Company Plant Number 9 begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 23.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Monday was 23.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Sunday morning and continue falling to 7.7 feet Thursday, March 16. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
